title: New signs found of giant gas planet in ’Earth’s neighbourhood’
byline: Scientists have found strong evidence of a giant gas planet in the nearest star system to our own.

title: Yevan David becomes first Sri Lankan to race in FIA Formula 3
byline: Eighteen-year-old Yevan David has made history by becoming the first Sri Lankan driver to compete in the FIA Formula 3 Championship.

title: More countries seek free visa entry into Sri Lanka
byline: In the wake of Sri Lanka waiving visa fees for nationals from 40 more countries, many other countries have sought the same facility for their nationals coming here as tourists, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Eyebrows raised as elephant deaths mount
byline: Elephant deaths in Sri Lanka are climbing at an alarming rate, with new figures showing dozens killed in just the first seven months of this year.

title: Sri Lanka concerned over Israel’s decision to take control of Gaza
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed deep concern over Israel’s decision to take control of Gaza, warning that it could lead to more violence and suffering for the people living there.

title: 2025 grade five scholarship exam tomorrow
byline: The 2025 Grade Five Scholarship Examination will be held tomorrow (10) at 2,787 examination centres across the country, the  of Examinations Department said.

title: Public Security Ministry denies any interference in police arrests
byline: The Ministry of Public Security has affirmed that neither Public Security Minister Ananda Wijepala nor any member of his staff will exert undue influence or interfere in police arrests or related actions.

title: Brussels considers recruiting ferrets to tackle rat population
byline: Authorities in Brussels are considering using ferrets to tackle the city’s longstanding issue with rats.

title: Jim Lovell, who guided Apollo 13 safely back to Earth, dies aged 97
byline:
Astronaut Jim Lovell, who guided the Apollo 13 mission safely back to Earth in 1970, has died aged 97.

Nasa said he had ’’turned a potential tragedy into a success’’ after an attempt to land on the Moon was aborted because of an explosion onboard the spacecraft while it was hundreds of thousands of miles from Earth.

title: Minister Nalinda weighs in on ‘Chichi’s Rocket’ controversy
byline: Health and Media Minister Nalinda Jayatissa has addressed the controversy surrounding the SupremeSAT satellite, widely referred to as “Chichi’s Rocket,” following conflicting statements in Parliament over its status and earnings.

title: Sri Lanka voices concern over Israel’s move to seize control of Gaza City
byline: Sri Lanka has expressed deep concern over Israel’s decision to seize control of Gaza City, warning that it would further escalate violence and worsen the suffering of its people.
